question:
In the course of a transatlantic voyage following the First World War, he magically acquired an honorific title of “Count” as well as a “von” in his name, a development due to his aquiline nose and social (i) ________ rather than his (ii) ________ genetics, which lacked any distinction, and he (iii) ________ successfully enough in New York City to parlay this charade into a small fortune.
Blank (i)
Blank (ii)
Blank (iii)
A. arrogance
D. peasant
G. coalesced
B. deftness
E. patrician
H. dissembled
C. maladroitness
F. perturbing
I. disseminated
Show
Hide
Answer
